</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Gets the marker shape. See [[setMarkerShape]] for a list of strings that can be returned. Possible return values:
* <tt>"ICON"</tt>
* <tt>"RECTANGLE"</tt>
* <tt>"ELLIPSE"</tt>
* <tt>"POLYLINE"</tt>
* <tt>"ERROR"</tt> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''markerShape''' name </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> name: [[String]] -  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[if]] ('''markerShape''' "Marker1" == "RECTANGLE") [[then]] {[[hint]] "Marker1 is a rectangle!"}</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[setMarkerShape]], [[setMarkerShapeLocal]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value>
